column4: Hey guys. I was wondering if you could help me with my freshly installed Ubuntu for x86 which I can't use because the X driver can't seem to load.
Someone told me to edit xorg.conf but when I tried it, apparently the file did not exist.

Anyway, my X won't load and I _suspect_ that it's because I set the driver to "ati" rather than "vesa". Even though I have an ATi Mobility Radeon 9800... so does anybody know how I manually change this? I don't want to have to fresh install over this. :p
open up /etc/X11/xorg.conf. It is probably in there.
someone told me to do that. I used "nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" but it was a blank edit screen--and at the bottom of the screen it said "[ new file ] ".
did you upgrade from Warty? Or was it a fresh install?
oh my... I'm sure it's there then. Look at the files listed when you do this "ls /etc/X11". There has to be a xorg.conf file.
you're in for alot of fun if you're up for it :)
I'll try that. Thanks.
it has it's merits ;)
it's "default" not "setdefault".
and it's already set to 0.
be root. Use sudo.
it will if you open it in an editor. Like "sudo nano /etc/X11/XF86Config-4".
what else is there?
to answer your question, it has not changed in Hoary.
patches welcome =P
don't you hate it when people say that? ahah
added what?
support for 1920x1200.
are the VertRefresh and HorizSync settings acurate in your config for your monitor?
in you /etc/X11/XF86Config file, there should be lines for VertRefresh and HorizSync. Do the values in there agree with your monitor specs?
not if Xfree want's to spare your hardware from a small fire.
